alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 01 at 2:35PM PST until March 06 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, except up to 2 feet above 7000 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph, with to 100 mph along the Sierra crest. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Strong winds may cause tree damage and lead to some power outages. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall may continue into Tuesday, becoming lighter and more showery in nature.
info.instruction: Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time.
